Arg.V:
#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk gtk3
exit 0

Vulnerability.Title: gtk3 bug fix update
Vulnerability.Description: The GTK+ library provides a multi-platform toolkit for creating graphical user interfaces. The gtk3 packages contain GTK+ version 3. This update fixes the following bugs: The missing manual pages gtk3-demo(1), gtk3-demo-application(1), and gtk3-widget-factory(1) have been added to the gtk3 packages. (BZ#948432) Prior to this update, repetitive resizing of a window using the GtkExpander menu item did not work correctly. Consequently, if the expander contained a GtkGrid which included a GtkLabel with wrapped text, repetitive expanding and collapsing made the window grow higher. This bug has been fixed, and the described problem no longer occurs. (BZ#982295) Previously, the Highlight Mode selection on the bottom status bar of the gedit text editor did not provide a scrolling capability. Consequently, some of the options were off the screen and thus not selectable. This bug has been fixed, and users are now able to select any of the listed syntax highlighting modes also from the bottom status bar. (BZ#1062938) Previously, an incorrect GtkTreePath was used when converting the path of the virtual root to check the ancestors. Consequently, when the user was switching between open application windows using the Alt+Tab keys, the gedit utility could terminate unexpectedly with a segmentation fault. This bug has been fixed, and gedit no longer crashes in this scenario. (BZ#1150290) Previously, when the user attempted to assign the F1 key to another function than help in the Keyboard Settings window, pressing F1 led to opening the GNOME Help window. As a consequence, it was impossible to remap the F1 key to another function. This bug has been fixed, and users are now able to reassign F1 to a chosen function. (BZ#1090126) Users of gtk3 are advised to upgrade to these updated packages, which fix these bugs. Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
